answers.answer: I think you should go. I have preeclamplsia for the 2nd time and haven't had that problem either pregnancy so I'd say something else is going on and you should get checked out.

Yes it is best that you go in not knocking your boyfried but most men think they know best go in .i had a friend who went into.full labor but because she wasnt over exaggerating. They sent her home and when.she went back to have her baby it was a stll born 11lb baby boy

Yes it is best that you go in not knocking your boyfried but most men think they know best go in .i had a friend who went into.full labor but because she wasnt over exaggerating. They sent her home and when.she went back to have her baby it was a stll born 11lb baby boy

If menstrual like cramps sounds like the early stages of labor.  if they progress and get closer together and get stronger, then def go to the hospital.  Don't take the tramadol.  Just try to withstand the pain as long as u can before going to the hospital.  Ur probably in labor and will be having ur baby soon!  Goodluck!!
I agree. Don't take the tramadol. You need to listen to body & your instincts, not your boyfriend because he literally has no clue what you're feeling.
If your dr is concerned about preeclampsia and you are having pain,  you need to get evaluated pronto. That can get dangerous fast so you don't want to wait. Hopefully you are already being checked.
Do what your Dr said, your bf is not a Dr. If your Dr said you need to be elevated then why are you second guessing him because of your bf?? Be smart hun, and good luck

Go see your doc. You have a high risk pregnancy and baby might need to come out soon before you get toxaemic. Don't ignore your symptoms - remember the aim is healthy baby and healthy you. If the doc offers you pain relief then feel free to take it.

question: Im 39 weeks pregnant, all day today ive been cramping (like menstrual cramps)and its been mild. Its been consistent... Not like contractions. Wednesday i went to the DR and i had a super high amount of protein in my urine & normal blood pressure. My.doc is concerned about preeclampsia. So i did a 24HR pee thing .. Which came back super elevated for protein. He told me to come back Monday to check my blood pressure. But today has been really painful with these cramps that havent went away. I text my doctor about a hour ago and asked him if it was ok to take Tramadol for the pain. He told me if i felt like i needed tramadol then i needed to go be evaluated. My boyfriend said i should just try the tramadol. Im debating on if i should go or just try the meds. Help?
title: Should I Go?
